fields.name: Literal responses
fields.value:
More advanced commands are available, such as if you want the bot to literally say some text, rather than reformatting it, you can for example type:
```@:user:, twitch is <reply> twitch is a streaming service.```
If you want the bot to tell you what is literally defined in the database for a fact you can type
```@:user: literal <keyword>```

fields.name: Newlines
fields.value: You can put a new line in your response by including the value

fields.name: Variables
fields.value:
You can use special keywords, which will be replaced: `````` the nickname (not as a mention) of the user talking to the bot. `````` the bot's current nickname. `````` the nickname (not as a mention) of a *random* user on the current discord server. `````` the date the bot learned the fact it is responding with `````` the current date and time. `````` Select one response from a comma separated list, e.g. ```` will return one of apple, orange or pear. Other variables may be values in the list. `````` Returns the number of messages spoken by the user ```
``` Insert a newline `````` Insert a literal | symbol, used for spoilers

fields.name: Randomised Responses
fields.value:
You can separate multiple responses with a pipe symbol ``|`` and the bot will pick one at random when responding. for example:
```@:user: roll a dice is <reply>one|<reply>two|<reply>three|<reply>four|<reply>five|<reply>six``` If you want to use an actual | character within a response, you can use <s> instead, which will be replaced with | when the bot responds. This allows you to still use spoilers.

fields.name: Further help
fields.value: You can find further help on the wiki's [advanced commands page](https://github.com/brainboxdotcc/sporks/wiki/Advanced-Chat-Commands).
